p: In addition to differentially retained introns, we identified 395 differentially used exons (diffUEs) in the Kasumi-1 transcriptome following RUNX1/RUNX1T1 knockdown (Fig. 1e, f; Supplementary Fig. 1j; Supplementary Data 6). The list of the identified diffUEs included 387 canonical exons and 8 retained introns affecting 275 genes (Fig. 1g, h). Interestingly, while these diffUEs were uniformly distributed across non-coding RNAs, in protein-coding transcripts they were significantly enriched for 5’-UTR exons and depleted for CDS, 3’-UTR and multi-type exons (Fig. 1i).
